author: James Fink
title: Visit Buffalo Niagara, Niagara Tourism CC secure peer accreditation
text:
Visit Buffalo Niagara, Niagara Tourism CC secure peer accreditation Jul 22, 2015, 7:11am EDT Share James Fink Reporter Buffalo Business First Home of the Day See All Homes of the Day For the first time, Visit Buffalo Niagara and Niagara Tourism & Convention Corp. have secured accreditation from Destination Marketing Association International, a tourism and convention association. Landing such a designation is considered a major coup when it comes to being on the booking radar screens of meeting planners and tourism groups. Only 11 agencies received the DMAI accreditation this year. “This accreditation gives credibility to what NTCC does on a daily basis,” said John Percy , NTCC president and CEO. To become accredited, a DMO, or destination marketing organization, must demonstrate compliance across 16 disciplines and successfully comply with 58 mandatory and 30 voluntary standards in areas that include governance, finance, human resources, sales, communications, destination development and research. DMAP is globally recognized by the destination marketing industry as the highest achievement in destination excellence. “It says a great deal about us, both internally and externally,” said Patrick Kaler , Visit Buffalo Niagara president and CEO. “It says that we run our organization at the highest level possible. That matters to planners and booking agencies.”
